---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [a6dde9ce86](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17531/commits/a6dde9ce865c5095586922736426d4f2534d706c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ isoColimit`
`+ isoLimit`
`+ isoLimit_hom_π`
`+ isoLimit_inv_π`
`+ lanObjObjIsoColimit`
`+ ranObjObjIsoLimit`
`+ ranObjObjIsoLimit_hom_π`
`+ ranObjObjIsoLimit_inv_π`
`+ ι_isoColimit_hom`
`+ ι_isoColimit_inv`
`+ ι_lanObjObjIsoColimit_hom`
`+ ι_lanObjObjIsoColimit_inv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I think it would be better to define this first in the `IsPointwiseLeftKanExtensionAt` namespace in the `Pointwise` file:
```lean
namespace IsPointwiseLeftKanExtensionAt

variable {E} {Y : D} (h : E.IsPointwiseLeftKanExtensionAt Y)
  [HasColimit (CostructuredArrow.proj L Y ⋙ F)]

noncomputable def isoColimit :
    E.right.obj Y ≅ colimit (CostructuredArrow.proj L Y ⋙ F) :=
  h.coconePointUniqueUpToIso (colimit.isColimit _)

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma ι_isoColimit_inv (g : CostructuredArrow L Y) :
    colimit.ι _ g ≫ h.isoColimit.inv = E.hom.app g.left ≫ E.right.map g.hom :=
  IsColimit.comp_coconePointUniqueUpToIso_inv _ _ _

@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
lemma ι_isoColimit_hom (g : CostructuredArrow L Y) :
    E.hom.app g.left ≫ E.right.map g.hom ≫ h.isoColimit.hom =
      colimit.ι (CostructuredArrow.proj L Y ⋙ F) g := by
  simpa using h.comp_coconePointUniqueUpToIso_hom (colimit.isColimit _) g

end IsPointwiseLeftKanExtensionAt
```
and then it can be applied to the particular sitatuation of `L.lan`.
Apart from my last two suggestions about names, I think this can be merged soon.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11420059218/job/31775335873)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11420059218/job/31775335914)
This will need some lemmas; certainly there should be a lemma saying what `colimit.ι _ ≫ lanObjObjIsoColimit.inv` is and perhaps also something for the other direction.
`@[simps]`?

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
  Limits.IsColimit.coconePointUniqueUpToIso
    (isPointwiseLeftKanExtensionLanUnit L F X)
    (Limits.colimit.isColimit (CostructuredArrow.proj L X ⋙ F))
```
(Actually, this could be generalized as a definition in the `IsPointwiseLeftKanExtensionAt` namespace.)

Most of the definitions in this PR are unnecessary/duplicates: the preferred API instead of `isoOfIsPointwiseLeftKanExtension` is `left/rightKanExtensionUnique` in the `.Basic` file.
Can you clarify what you mean by "most of"? The two `isoOfIsPointwise...KanExtension` or also the simp lemmas?

```suggestion
@[reassoc (attr := simp)]
```

```suggestion
@[reassoc]
lemma lanObjObjIsoColimit_lanUnit_map_hom
```

Hmm, I changed this in order to not have to create local instances of `Limits.HasColimit (CostructuredArrow.proj L X ⋙ (𝟭 (C ⥤ H)).obj F)`  in the new lemmas, but it causes problems further down in `Functor.Flat`. Should I revert it and have the loacl instances? @joelriou
Ah, nevermind, I noticed I just need to add a `(F := F)`

Untested, but if this works, this is the preferred syntax:
```suggestion
    Limits.colimit.ι (CostructuredArrow.proj L X ⋙ F) f :=
  LeftExtension.IsPointwiseLeftKanExtensionAt.ι_isoColimit_hom (F := F)
    (isPointwiseLeftKanExtensionLanUnit L F X) f
```
(Same remark for the dual statement.)

```suggestion
lemma ι_lanObjObjIsoColimit_inv
```

```suggestion
lemma ι_lanObjObjIsoColimit_hom
```
(Alternatively, a longer name could be given, but it should have `lanObjObjIsoColimit_hom` as a suffix in order to follow naming conventions.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/KanExtensions): Evaluating `lan` twice amounts to taking a colimit
